intro: Adenia barthelatii, commonly known as the Barthelat's adenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with showy, five-petaled flowers that attract various pollinators. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
